WorkItem.Description:
I am not able to remove the markers that show up in the line chart series. Please suggest how to format the styles for these markers.

In Excel directly i can right click on the graph, format data series, select none for the marker options and select "No fill". Please advice how this can be achieved via phpExcel.

Thanks
WorkItem.Summary: Remove markers from line chart data series

Comments.Message: Same question: how to remove markers from line-type chart. Thanks

Fantastic, __$dataSeriesValues1 [0]->setPointMarker('none')__ works!
I knew that "array" thing was the different. Thank you very much!

ps: now the line is very thin: you know how to "bold" it?
![Image](http://s29.postimg.org/okexblstz/Schermata_2014_06_09_a_11_21_01.png)

Thanks. 

To thicken the line, I could not find any built in methods similar to setPointmarker().
In my case, always I wanted the series line to be thick. To increase the thickness, I did the following
* Open the file phpexcel/Classes/PHPExcel/Writer/Excel2007/Chart.php
* Go to line number 800 OR search for the line "$objWriter->writeAttribute('w', 12700);" in the method _writePlotGroup
* The second attribute in the above line of code is directly proportional to the thihkness of the chart line. Increase its value and the thickness increases.

This is a hack that is not very consistent because you may want different thickness for different lines.


Thanks

Fantastic: Chart.php -> "$objWriter->writeAttribute('w', x);", where x define the tickness of the line.
In my case this hack is ok, 'cause I need only one type tickness! Thank you so much!

ps: I suppose that for the colour of the graph it's the same type hack... I don't like the red area-chart... and i will need to change the color of the line or/and of the area chart.
